bib.title: Experimental study of some important characteristics of the thermal neutron induced fission of Np-237

Cross section and ternary fission measurements
made at the end of the 87 m curved neutron guide.
Mass and energy measurements made at neutron beam IH1
collimated to 1 cm diameter. Thermal flux of
for cross section and ternary fission  measurements,
NP-F4, containing the following isotopic composition,
Np-235 less than 0.0005%, Np-236 less than 0.0005%,
Np-238 less than 0.003%,  Np-239 less than 0.003%.
-For cross section and ternary fission measurements
a 382 micro-g/cm2 of Np-237 layer was evaporated
onto a Mylar backing. For calibration a similar
layer of 10 micro-g/cm2 of U-235 was used.
-For mass and energy measurements a 111 micro-g/cm2
of Np-237 layer and a 129 micro-g/cm2 U-235 of layer,
evaporated onto 30 micro-g/cm2 of polyimide foil used.

used as E-delta E. Delta E detector thickness
resolution better than 55 keV for 5.5 MeV alphas.
